column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////My mom and I luckily snuck in for an early dinner without reservations and were seated right away. The atmosphere is very charming - completely transports you out of modern Chicago and back in time. Hosts and wait staff were friendly. The complimentary bread was warm and fantastic; we asked for another round. I thought the oysters were pretty good
column2: considering we're in the Midwest and not really near oyster harvesting waters. We shared the 22oz ribeye with bone marrow and a loaded baked potato. The meat had great natural flavors but was overly salty. Otherwise
column3: no complaints for the food. Prices are fair considering the venue. You can actually get away with a reasonably priced meal if you select the right options from their menu. Good place for a date or business dinner.
